glsa.title: CherryPy: Directory traversal vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: CherryPy is vulnerable to a directory traversal that could allow attackers to read arbitrary files.

background.p: CherryPy is a Python-based, object-oriented web development framework.

description.p: Ivo van der Wijk discovered that the "staticfilter" component of CherryPy fails to sanitize input correctly.

impact.p: An attacker could exploit this flaw to obtain arbitrary files from the web server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All CherryPy users should upgrade to the latest version:
